*Today’s Verse:*

*At this, I woke up and looked around. My*

* sleep had been very sweet.*(Jer. 31:26)



*Today’s Reflection:*

God Invites You to come to Him and He

will restore and replenish your energy. He

will refocus your mind and heart. He will

supply your weary soul and you will wake

feeling comforted and loved. *Dear Lord,*

*fill my weary soul with Your perfect *

*peace.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text: God Invites You to come to Him and He will restore and replenish your energy. He will refocus your mind and heart. He will supply your weary soul and you will wake feeling comforted and loved. Dear Lord, fill my weary soul with Your perfect peace.
original_verse_text: At this, I woke up and looked around. My sleep had been very sweet.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You, the Good Shepherd, weary and in need of Your restoration. Renew our strength and focus our hearts on You, the source of living water. Replenish our souls, that we may wake refreshed, comforted by Your abiding love. Fill us with Your perfect peace, Lord, that we may dwell securely in Your presence. Amen.
reflection: God invites you to come to Him, and He will restore and replenish your energy. He will refocus your mind and heart. He will supply your weary soul, and you will wake feeling comforted and loved. Dear Lord, fill my weary soul with Your perfect peace.
subject: Rest Your Weary Soul
verse_text: At this, I woke up and looked around. My sleep had been very sweet.

*Subject: BE AN ENCOURAGER *(9-3-20)



*Today’s Verse: *

*“Has the Lord spoken only through Moses?”*

*they asked. “Hasn’t He also spoken through*

*us?” and the Lord heard this. *(Heb. 12:2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

IN THE ABOVE verse, when Mariam and

Aaron witnessed God using Moses, they

were jealous. Praising others and being

happy for other’s spiritual or natural gifts

can be difficult. But when you recognize

that your work and your relationship with

God is equally important, *you can truly*

*appreciate the blessings of others and*

*be positive about their achievements. *

* Pastor Sather *
original_reflection_text:
IN THE ABOVE verse, when Mariam and
Aaron witnessed God using Moses, they
were jealous. Praising others and being
happy for other’s spiritual or natural gifts
can be difficult. But when you recognize
that your work and your relationship with
God is equally important, you can truly appreciate the blessings of others and be positive about their achievements.
original_verse_text: “Has the Lord spoken only through Moses?” they asked. “Hasn’t He also spoken through us?” and the Lord heard this.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, recognizing that our worth and purpose are not defined by the gifts or achievements of others. Help us to set aside any jealousy or envy, and instead, to celebrate the blessings You bestow upon Your children. May we find joy in the successes of our brothers and sisters, and may our own relationship with You be the true source of our fulfillment. Guide us to appreciate the unique ways in which You have called each of us to serve. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: IN THE ABOVE verse, when Mariam and Aaron witnessed God using Moses, they were jealous. Praising others and being happy for other’s spiritual or natural gifts can be difficult. But when you recognize that your work and your relationship with God is equally important, you can truly appreciate the blessings of others and be positive about their achievements.
subject: Be an Encourage
verse_text: “Has the Lord spoken only through Moses?” they asked. “Hasn’t He also spoken through us?” and the Lord heard this.

*Today’s Verse:*

*Godliness helps people all through life, *

*while **the evil are destroyed by their wickedness. *(Pro. 13:6)



*Today’s Verse:*

Godly living safeguards your life.

Every choice for good sets into motion

other opportunities for good. Evil choices follow the same patter, but in
an opposite direction. Each decision you make to obey God will bring a
greater sense of order to

your life, while each decision to disobey

will bring confusion and destruction*. *

The right choices you make reflect your integrity. *Obe**dience **brings
the greatest safeguard and **security.*

* Pastor Sather *

destroyed by their wickedness.

Help us to walk in the path of righteousness, for Your Word declares that righteousness guards the blameless, while wickedness overthrows the sinner. May we sow to the Spirit, that we may reap eternal life. Grant us the wisdom to make choices that honor You, for we know that whatever a person sows, that they will also reap. In Your steadfast love, guide us to live with integrity, that our lives may be a testimony to Your goodness. Amen.
reflection: Godly living safeguards your life. Every choice for good sets into motion other opportunities for good. Evil choices follow the same pattern, but in an opposite direction. Each decision you make to obey God will bring a greater sense of order to your life, while each decision to disobey will bring confusion and destruction. The right choices you make reflect your integrity. Obedience brings the greatest safeguard and security.

destroyed by their wickedness.

*Today’s Verse:*

*The thief’s purpose is to steal and kill and *

*destroy. **My purpose is to give life in all its *

*fullness. *(Jn. 10:10)



*Today’s Reflection:*

In contrast to the thief who takes life, Jesus

gives life. The life He gives right now is

abundantly rich and full. It is eternal, yet it

begins immediately. Life in Christ is lived

on a higher plain because of his overflowing forgiveness, love, and guidance

*Have you taken Christ’s offer of life?*

* Pastor Sather*.

In contrast to the thief who takes life, Jesus gives life.
The life He gives right now is abundantly rich and full. It is eternal, yet it begins immediately. Life in Christ is lived on a higher plain because of his overflowing forgiveness, love, and guidance
Have you taken Christ’s offer of life?

prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the abundant life that Jesus has promised to all who believe in Him. Thank You for the eternal life that begins the moment we put our trust in Your Son, and for the richness of living under His forgiveness, love, and guidance. May we wholeheartedly embrace the life You offer, and may it overflow from us to those around us. In Jesus' name, Amen.

*Today’s Verse:*

*Peter said, Ananias, why has Satan filled your heart?*

*You lied to the Holy Spirit and you kept some of the*

*money for yourself. *(Acts. 5:3)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Even though the Holy Spirit had come, the believers

were not immune to Satan’s temptations. Although

Satan was defeated by Christ at the cross he was

actively trying to make believers stumble—just as he

is still at it today (Eph. 6:12; I Pet. 5:8) Thank the Lord

Satan’s overthrow is inevitable, *but it will not occur *

*until the last days, when Jesus returns to judge the *

*world (Rev. 20:10).*

* Pastor Sather *
original_reflection_text:
Even though the Holy Spirit had come, the believers
were not immune to Satan’s temptations. Although
Satan was defeated by Christ at the cross he was
actively trying to make believers stumble-just as he
is still at it today (Ephesians 6:12; I Peter 5:8) Thank the Lord
Satan’s overthrow is inevitable, but it will not occur until the last days, when Jesus returns to judge the world (Revelation 20:10).
original_subject: KEEPING YOUR EYES FIXED ON JESUS
original_verse_text: Peter said, Ananias, why has Satan filled your heart? You lied to the Holy Spirit and you kept some of the money for yourself.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging the ongoing battle we face against the schemes of the evil one. Though Satan seeks to tempt and deceive us, we know that his ultimate defeat is certain, for You have already secured victory through the cross of Christ. Grant us the wisdom and discernment to stand firm in Your armor, that we may resist the devil's attacks and remain steadfast in our faith. May Your Holy Spirit empower us to overcome the spiritual forces of wickedness, for we know that our true struggle is not against flesh and blood, but against the rulers, authorities, and cosmic powers of this dark world. We trust in Your sovereign plan and look forward to the day when Jesus returns to judge the world and Satan is cast into eternal darkness. Amen.
reflection: Even though the Holy Spirit had come, the believers were not immune to Satan's temptations. Although Satan was defeated by Christ at the cross, he was actively trying to make believers stumble—just as he is still at it today (Ephesians 6:12; 1 Peter 5:8). Thank the Lord, Satan's overthrow is inevitable, but it will not occur until the last days, when Jesus returns to judge the world (Revelation 20:10).
subject: Keeping Your Eyes Fixed on Jesus

from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

*Today’s Verse: *

*Devote yourself to prayer with an alert mind and a*

*thankful heart. *(Col. 4:2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Have you ever grown tired of praying for something

or someone? Paul says we should “devote” ourselves

to prayer and be “alert” in prayer. Our persistence is

an expression of our faith that God answers prayers.

Faith shouldn’t die if the answers come slowly, for

the delay may be God’s way of working His will in

our life. When you feel tired of praying, know that

God is present, always listening always answering—

maybe not in ways you hoped, *but in ways that **He *

*knows are best.*

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
Have you ever grown tired of praying for something
or someone? Paul says we should “devote” ourselves
to prayer and be “alert” in prayer. Our persistence is
an expression of our faith that God answers prayers.
Faith should’t die if the answers come slowly, for
the delay may be God’s way of working His will in
our life. When you feel tired of praying, know that
God is present, always listening always answering maybe not in ways you hoped, but in ways that He knows are best.
original_verse_text: Devote yourself to prayer with an alert mind and a thankful heart.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging Your constant presence and Your perfect timing. Help us to be devoted to prayer, remaining alert and persistent, even when the answers seem slow in coming. Strengthen our faith, Lord, that we may trust in Your will and Your ways, knowing that You work all things for the good of those who love You. May our prayers be an expression of our unwavering trust in Your sovereign plan. Amen.
reflection: Have you ever grown tired of praying for something or someone? Paul says we should "devote" ourselves to prayer and be "alert" in prayer. Our persistence is an expression of our faith that God answers prayers. Faith shouldn't die if the answers come slowly, for the delay may be God's way of working His will in our life. When you feel tired of praying, know that God is present, always listening, always answering—maybe not in ways you hoped, but in ways that He knows are best.

*Subject: THE HARDEST PART *(9-8-20)



*Today’s Verse:*

*Wait for the Lord: be strong and take heart and wait *

*for **the Lord. **(Ps. 27:14)*



*Today’s Reflection:*

David knew from experience what it meant to wait for

the Lord. He had been anointed king at the age of 16

but didn’t become king until he was 30. During the interim, he was chased
through the wilderness by

jealous king Saul. Davie had to wait on God for the fulfilment of his
promise to reign. Later, after becoming king he was chased by his rebellious
son*. Some Times God Calls *us to wait and not act. Our job is to continue

to trust Him along the way. *To **surrender our will to *

*His, to exchange our timing for **His KNOWING *

*that He holds every moment in His **hands.*

* Pastor Sather*

but didn’t become king until he was 30. During the interim, he was chased through the wilderness by jealous king Saul. Davie had to wait on God for the fulfillment of his promise to reign. Later, after becoming king he was chased by his rebellious son. Some Times God Calls us to wait and not act.
Our job is to continue to trust Him along the way. To surrender our will to His, to exchange our timing for His KNOWING that He holds every moment in His hands.
original_verse_text: Wait for the Lord: be strong and take heart and wait  for  the Lord.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that Your timing is perfect, even when it requires us to wait. Like David, we have experienced the challenges of delayed fulfillment, but we trust in Your sovereign plan. Help us to surrender our will to Yours, exchanging our timing for Yours, knowing that You hold every moment in Your hands. Give us the strength to be still and wait patiently for Your guidance and deliverance. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: David knew from experience what it meant to wait for the Lord. He had been anointed king at the age of 16 but didn’t become king until he was 30. During the interim, he was chased through the wilderness by jealous king Saul. Davie had to wait on God for the fulfillment of his promise to reign. To surrender our will to His, to exchange our timing for His KNOWING that He holds every moment in His hands.

*Today’s Verse:*

*The law of the Lord is perfect, reviving the soul.*

*The decrees of the Lord are trustworthy, making*

*wise the simple. *(Ps. 19:7)—for further reading

read verses 8-11


*Today’s Reflection:*

When we think of the law, we often think of

something that keeps us from having fun. But

here we see the opposite. God’s laws revive us,

make us wise, bring joy to the heart, give us

insight, warn us, and reward us. God’s laws

are guidelines and lights for our path, rather

than chains to our feet and hands. *They point*

* at danger to warn us, then point at success*

*to guide us.*

* Pastor Sather*

prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for Your perfect and life-giving law. Your commands are not burdensome, but rather they revive our souls, making us wise and filling our hearts with joy. Your precepts are a lamp to our feet and a light to our path, guiding us away from danger and toward the blessings You have in store. Help us to delight in Your word and find great reward in following Your ways. In Jesus' name, Amen.

*Today’s Verse:*

*So everywhere we go we tell everyone about Christ.*

*We warn them and teach them with all the wisdom*

*God has given us, for we want to present them to*

*God, perfect in their relationship to Christ. I work*

*very hard at this, as I depend on Christ’s mighty*

*power that works within us. *(Col 1:28-29)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Christ’s message is for everyone; so everywhere Paul

and Timothy went, they brought the Good News to all

who would listen. An effective presentation of the Good

News includes warning and teaching. The warning is

that without Christ, people are doomed to eternal

separation from God. The teaching is that salvation

is available through faith in Christ. As Christ works

in you, tell others about Him, warning and teaching

them in love*. Whom do you know who needs **to hear *

*this message.*

* Pastor Sather *

them in love. Whom do you know who needs to hear this message.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging Your Son, Jesus Christ, as the source of all wisdom and truth. Help us to grow in maturity, speaking the truth in love, that we may present everyone complete in Christ. May we boldly proclaim the Good News, warning and teaching all who will listen, that they may know the hope found in You. Guide us by Your Spirit, that we may faithfully fulfill the ministry You have entrusted to us. Amen.

An effective presentation of the Good News includes warning and teaching. The warning is that without Christ, people are doomed to eternal separation from God. *Today’s Verse:*

*The Holy Spirit helps us in our distress. For we **don’t even know what we
should pray for, nor **how we should pray. But the Holy Spirit prays **for
us with groanings that cannot be expressed **in words.—And the Father who
knows all hearts **knows what the Spirit is saying, for the Spirit **pleads
for us believers *

*in harmony with God’s** own will. *

(Ro. 8:26, 27)

*Today’ Reflection:*

As a believer, you are not left to your own

resources to cope with your problems. Even

when you don’t know the right words to pray,

the Holy Spirit prays with and for you, and

God answers. With God helping you pray,

you don’t need to be afraid to come before

Him. Ask the Holy Spirit to intercede for

you,” in harmony with God’s will.” *Then,*

*when you bring your request to God trust*

*that He will always do what is best.*

* Pastor Sather*

the Holy Spirit prays with and for you, and

Him.
Ask the Holy Spirit to intercede for

original_verse_text: The Holy Spirit helps us in our distress. For we don’t even know what we should pray for, nor how we should pray. But the Holy Spirit prays for us with groaning that cannot be expressed in words.-And the Father who knows all hearts knows what the Spirit is saying, for the Spirit pleads for us believers  in harmony with God’s own will.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging our weakness and our inability to always find the right words to express our deepest needs and concerns. We are grateful that Your Holy Spirit intercedes for us, even when we do not know how to pray. Help us to trust in Your perfect will and to bring our requests to You, knowing that You will always do what is best. Guide us, Lord, as we seek to pray in harmony with Your divine purposes. We thank You for the assurance that You hear our prayers and that You will answer according to Your perfect plan. Amen.
reflection: As a believer, you are not left to your own resources to cope with your problems. Even when you don't know the right words to pray, the Holy Spirit prays with and for you, and God answers. With God helping you pray, you don't need to be afraid to come before Him. Ask the Holy Spirit to intercede for you, "in harmony with God's will." Then, when you bring your request to God, trust that He will always do what is best.

*Subject: BEYOND COMPREHENSION *(9-12-20)



*Today’s Verse*

*How great is God—beyond our understanding! The *

*number of His years is past finding out. *

(Job 36:26) NIV

*Today’s Reflection:*

It goes without saying that God is incomprehensible; we cannot know Him
completely. We can have some knowledge about Him, for the Bible is full of
details about who God is, how can we know Him, and how we have an eternal
relationship with Him. But we

can never know enough to answer all of life’s questions (Eccl. 3:11), to
predict our future, or to manipulate God for our own ends. Life always

creates more questions than we have answers, and

*we must constantly go to God **for fresh insights *

*into life’s dilemmas*. (See Job 37:19-24)

*Pastor Sather*

Life always creates more questions than we have answers, and we must constantly go to God for fresh insights into life’s dilemmas. (See Job 37:19-24)

You are beyond our full comprehension, yet You have revealed Yourself to us through Your Word. Help us to humbly accept the limitations of our understanding, and to trust in Your perfect wisdom and sovereign plan. May we seek You diligently, knowing that You will guide us and provide the insights we need for life's journey. In Your name, we pray. Amen.

*Today’s Verse:*

*So, my dear brothers and sisters, be strong and*

*steady, always enthusiastic about the Lord’s *

*work, for you know that nothing you do for*

*the Lord is ever useless. *(I Cor. 15:58)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Paul says because of the resurrection, nothing we

do is useless. Sometimes we become apathetic

about serving the Lord because we don’t see any

results. Knowing that Christ has won the ultimate

victory should affect the way we live right now.

Don’t let discouragement over an apparent lack

of results keep you from doing the work of the

Lord enthusiastically as you have an opportunity.

*Pastor Sather*

the other prisoners *

*were listening to **them. *(Acts 16:25)

respond to dark and diff-icult times is a test of true character. In our
verse today despite their suffering, Paul and Silas praise God. They
worship in the worst of circumstances and inspire others by their actions.
*Dear **Lord *

*help me to hold on to faith when suffering pain*

*or encountering other difficulties, so that I maybe a **testimony to your
glory.*

* Pastor Sather*

the nature of heaven, and the resurrection, we are to

*Today’s Verse:*

*Then Jesus told them, “You believe because you have seen me. **Blessed are
those who have not seen me and believe anyway. **(Jn. 20:29)*

*Today’s Reflection:*

Some people think they would believe in Jesus if they could see a definite
sign or miracle. *But *Jesus says we are blessed if we can believe without
seeing. *Remember* we have all the proof we need in the words of the Bible
and the testimony of believers. *A physical appearance would not make
Jesus **any more real to us than He is now.*

* Pastor Sather*



*Dear Lord help me to see You more clearly in the words **of the
Bible—Amen. *

*Today’s Verse:*

*The one siting on the throne said, “I am making*

* all things new!” And He also said, “write this*

* down, for what I tell you is trustworthy and*

*true.”*



*Today’s Reflection:*

God is the Creator. The Bible begins with the

majestic story of His creation of the universe,

and it concludes with His creation of a new

heaven and a new earth. This is a tremendous

hope and encouragement for the believer.

When we are with God, with our sins forgiven

and our future secure, we will be like Christ.

*We will be made perfect like Him.*

*Pastor Sather*



*Dear Lord, today I will seek out the unfamiliar*

*And embrace new experiences…Amen.*

subject   : Subject: LETS EXAMINE OUR MOTIVES (9-18-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

*Today’s Verse:*

*“Stop judging others, and you will not be judged.for others will treat you
as you treat them. Whatever measure you use in judging others, it will be
used to measure how you are judged.” *(Mt 7:1-2)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus tells us to examine our own motives and con-duct instead of judging
others. The traits that bother us in others are often the habits we have
ourselves. Our bad habits and behavior patterns are the very ones that we
most want to change in others. Do you find it easy to magnify other’s
faults while excusing your own? If you are ready to criticize someone,
check to see if you deserve the same criticism. *Judge yourself first, and
then lovingly forgive and help your neighbor. *

* Pastor Sather *

Grant us the wisdom to extend the same compassion and understanding to our neighbors that we desire for ourselves. May we be quick to forgive and slow to condemn, following the example of Your Son, Jesus. Amen.

*Today’s Verses:*

*“Don’t be troubled. You trust in God, now trust in Me , there are many
rooms in My Father’s home, and I am going to prepare a place for you .If
this were not so, I would tell you plainly. When every-thing is ready, I
will come and get you.”* (Jn. 14:1-3)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus’ words show that the way to eternal life, though unseen, is
secure—as secure as your faith in Jesus. He has already prepared the way to
eternal life. The only issue that may still be unsettled is your
willingness to believe. Yes we can look forward to eternal life because
Jesus has promised it to all who believe in Him. *Although the details of
eternity are unknown, we need not fear* *because Jesus is pre-paring it for
us and will spend eternity with us.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject   : Subject: USING FAITH FOR THE RIGHT REASON (9-20-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;

*Today’s Verse:*

*What do you mean, “If I can?” **Jesus asked. Anything is **possible if a
person believes. *(Mk 9:23)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Take note here, Jesus’ words do not mean that we can

automatically obtain anything we want if we just think

positively. Jesus really meant that anything is possible

if we believe, because nothing is to difficult for God. We cannot have
everything we pray for as if by magic, but with faith, we can have
everything we need to serve Him. *No matter how much faith we have,*

*we never **reach the point of being self-sufficient.*

* Pastor Sather *

Lord, increase our faith, that we may see the impossible become possible through Your mighty hand. We trust in Your perfect plan, for nothing is too difficult for You. Amen.

*Today’s Verse:*

*But Jesus replied,” ”That isn’t necessary—you feed them.” “Impossible!”** they
exclaimed. “We have only five loafs and two fish!” “Bring them here,” **He
said. *

*Then He told the people to sit down on the grass. And He took the **five
loafs and two fish, looked toward heaven, and asked God’s blessing on **the
food. *

(Mt. 14: 16—18a)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus desires that we should surrender to is service

the little we have, our small gifts and strengths and

resources. The rest He will look after. His blessing

will make the little suffice. Unbelief says that it is insufficient to come
with the *little** we have for an*

enterprise so great! Faith says, Jesus asks for the

little we have, and He will take it into His service.

He will bless it until there is more than enough. *When we lay our gift
in the Lord’s hand *

*(and * *not in any man’s)** it will stretch as *

*far as the Lord wills.*

* Pastor Sather*

subject   : Subject: A RIGHT RELATIONSHIP IS A HEAT-FELT TRUST (9-22-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 21 Sep 2020 17:48:02 -0500

*Today’s Verse:*

*And Abraham believed the Lord, and the Lord declared him righteous because
of his faith. *

(Gen. 15:6)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Although Abram had been demonstrating his faith

Through his actions, it was his belief in the Lord,

not his actions, that made Abram right with God

(Ro. 41:5). YES, we too, can have a right relation-

ship with God by trusting Him. Our outward actions,

church attendance, prayer, good deeds—will not by

themselves make us right will Good. A right relationship is based on
faith—the heartfelt inner confidence that God is who He says He is and does
what He says He will do. *Right actions will follow naturally as by-*
*products.*

* Pastor Sather *

May our actions flow naturally from this deep faith, not as a means to earn Your favor, but as a response to Your unfailing love. We give You all the glory, Lord. Amen.

subject   : Subject: PERFECTING ONES FAITH (9-23-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>

*Today’s Verses:*

*Later on God tested Abram’s faith and obedience.*

*“Abraham!” God called. “Yes” he replied. “He*

*I am.” “Take your son, your only son—yes, Isaac, whom you love so much—and
go to the land of*

*Moriah. Sacrifice him there as a burn offering on *

*one of the mountains, which I will point out to you.” The next morning
Abraham got up early. He saddled his donkey and took two of his servants
with him, along with his son Isaac, *(Gen. 22:1-3a)



*Today’s Reflection:*

God tested Abraham, not to trip him up and watch

him fall, but to deepen his capacity to obey God and thus to develop his
character. Just as fire refines ore

to extract precious metals. I believe you will agree

that God has refined us a time or two through diffi-

cult circumstance. When we are tested we can com-plain, or we can try
to see how God is stretching us,

to develop our character. Obeying God is often a struggle because it may
mean giving up something

we truly want.* We should not expect our obedience to God to be easy or to
come naturally.*

* Pastor Sather*

When we are tested we can complain, or we can try to see how God is stretching us, to develop our character. Obeying God is often a struggle because it may mean giving up something we truly want. We should not expect our obedience to God to be easy or to come naturally.

Sacrifice him there as a burn offering on  one of the mountains, which I will point out to you.” The next morning Abraham got up early. He saddled his donkey and took two of his servants with him, along with his son Isaac,

Like Abraham, may we have the faith to trust in Your perfect plan, even when it requires us to surrender what we hold dear. Grant us the strength to obey, even when it is difficult, that we may grow in our love and devotion to You. Mold us, Lord, as the fire refines precious metal, that we may be vessels fit for Your purpose. Amen.
reflection: God tested Abraham, not to trip him up and watch him fall, but to deepen his capacity to obey God and thus to develop his character. Just as fire refines ore to extract precious metals. I believe you will agree that God has refined us a time or two through difficult circumstances. When we are tested, we can complain, or we can try to see how God is stretching us, to develop our character. Obeying God is often a struggle because it may mean giving up something we truly want. We should not expect our obedience to God to be easy or to come naturally.
subject: Perfecting Ones Faith

*Today’s Verse:*

*Look at the proud! They trust in themselves, and their*

*lives are crooked.; but the righteous will live by their*

*faith. *(Hab. 2:4)


*Today’s Reflection:*

The wicked Babylonians trusted in themselves and

would fall, but the righteous live by their faith and

trust in God. This verse has inspired countless Christ-

ians. Paul quotes It in Ro. 1:17, and in Gal, 3:11. The writer of Heb.
quotes it in 10:38, just before the chap-

ter on faith. And it is helpful to all Christians who must live through
difficult times with-out seeing signs of hope*. Christians must trust that
God is **directing all things according to His purpose.*

* Pastor Sather*

good things on the crown of His creation? *Little*

* faith! *This criticism typically comes after people

underestimate God or His Son. *How great is your*

*faith.*

*Today’s Verse:*

Jesus was amazed, turning to the crowd He said,

“I tell you the truth, I haven’t seen faith life this

in all the land of Israel!” (Mt 8:10)



*Today’s Reflection: *

Jesus told the crowd that many religious Jews who

should be in the Kingdom would be excluded be-

cause of their lack of faith. *What would Jesus say*

*about your faith*? We must be careful not to become

so set in our religious habits that we expect God to

work only in specific ways. *Don’t limit God by *

*your mind-set and lack of faith. . .*

* Pastor Sather*

*Subject: FOLLOW UP, OF THE WITHERED *

* FIG TREE* (9-27-20)



*Today’s Verse:*

*Then Jesus told them, “I assure you that if you have *

*faith and d**o not doubt, you can do things like this and much more. You** can
even say to this mountain, ‘may *

*God lift you up and throw** you into the sea,’ and it will happen.” *(Mt.
21:21)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Many have wondered about Jesus’ statement that if

we have faith and do not doubt, we can move moun-

tains. Jesus of course, was not suggesting that His followers use prayer as
some “magic” act. Instead,

He was making a strong point about the disciples’

(*and our*) lack of faith.

What kinds of mountains do you face? Have you

*really *talked to God about them? *How strong is your faith?*

* Pastor Sather*

subject   : Subject: CALMING STORMS (9-28-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Sun, 27 Sep 2020 16:40:05 -0500
===================================================================

*Today’s Verse**s:*

(The disciples fear of the storm) “Teacher, don’t

you even care that we are going to drown?” When

He woke up, He rebuked the wind and said to the

water, “Quiet down.” Suddenly the wind stopped,

and there was a great calm. And He asked them,

“why are you so afraid? Do you still have no faith

in Me?” (Mk. 5:38b-40)


*Today’s Reflection**:*

The disciples panicked because the storm threatened

to destroy them all, and Jesus seemed unaware and unconcerned. Theirs was a
physical storm, but storms

also come in other forms. Think about the storms in

your life—the situations that cause you great anxiety. Whatever your
difficulty,
you have two options; you

can worry and assume that Jesus no longer cares, or

you can resist fear putting your trust in Him.

*When you feel like panicking. confess your need *

*for God and**then trust Him to care for you.*

* Pastor Sather*

Suddenly the wind stopped, and there was a great calm. And He asked them, "why are you so afraid? Do you still have no faith in Me?"
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come to You in the midst of the storms that threaten to overwhelm us. Like the disciples, we sometimes feel that You are unaware or unconcerned about our struggles. Help us to resist the temptation to worry and instead put our trust in Your sovereign care. Remind us that You are in control, and that we need not be anxious about the challenges we face. We surrender our fears to You, Lord, and ask that You would calm the storms in our lives. In Your name, we pray. Amen.

When you feel like panicking, confess your need for God and then trust Him to care for you.

message_id: 174d6b82a1dd3adb
subject   : Subject: THE POWER TO FORGIVE (9-29-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Mon, 28 Sep 2020 16:57:08 -0500
===================================================================

*Today’s Verse:*

(To the woman who anointed Jesus’ feet) *Jesus said*

*to the woman,**“Your faith has saved you; go in peace.” *(Lk. 7:50)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Overflowing love is the natural response to forgive-

ness and the appropriate consequence of faith. But

only those who realize the depth of their sin can appre-

ciate the complete forgiveness God offers them. Jesus

has rescued all of His followers, whether they were

once extremely wicked or conventionally good from

eternal death. But the Pharisees believed that only

God could forgive sins, so they wondered why this

man Jesus was saying that the woman’s sins were forgiven. They did not
grasp the fact that Jesus was

indeed God. *Do you appreciate the **wideness of *

*God’s mercy? Are you grateful for His **forgiveness? *

* Pastor Sather*
original_reflection_text:
Overflowing love is the natural response to forgive ness and the appropriate consequence of faith. But only those who realize the depth of their sin can appre ciate the complete forgiveness God offers them. Jesus has rescued all of His followers, whether they were once extremely wicked or conventionally good from
eternal death. But the Pharisees believed that only God could forgive sins, so they wondered why this man Jesus was saying that the woman’s sins were forgiven. They did not grasp the fact that Jesus was indeed God. Do you appreciate the wideness of God’s mercy? Are you grateful for His forgiveness?
original_verse_text: (To the woman who anointed Jesus’ feet) Jesus said to the woman, "Your faith has saved you; go in peace."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, overwhelmed by the depth of Your love and the abundance of Your forgiveness. Like the woman in the Scriptures, we recognize the gravity of our sin and the immense grace You have shown us through the sacrifice of Your Son, Jesus. Lord, open our eyes to the wideness of Your mercy, that we may truly appreciate the freedom and new life You offer. Fill us with gratitude for Your unfailing compassion, and empower us to extend that same grace to others. Amen.
reflection: Overflowing love is the natural response to forgiveness and the appropriate consequence of faith. But only those who realize the depth of their sin can appreciate the complete forgiveness God offers them. Jesus has rescued all of His followers, whether they were once extremely wicked or conventionally good, from eternal death. But the Pharisees believed that only God could forgive sins, so they wondered why this man Jesus was saying that the woman's sins were forgiven. They did not grasp the fact that Jesus was indeed God. Do you appreciate the wideness of God's mercy? Are you grateful for His forgiveness?

original_content:
message_id: 174dbf1535c736d4
subject   : Subject: QUESTIONING OUR FAITH (9-30-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Tue, 29 Sep 2020 17:17:40 -0500
===================================================================
Body (clean, unformatted):

*Today’s Verses:*

*One day the apostles said to the Lord, “We need more faith; tell us how to
get it.” **Even if you had faith as *

*small as a mustard seed,,” ** the Lord answered, “you*

*could say to the mulberry tree, may God uproot you *

*and throw you into the **sea,’ and it would obey you.” *

(Lk. 17:5-6)



*Today’s Reflection: *

The disciples’ request was genuine, they wanted the

faith necessary for such radical forgiveness. But Jesus

did not directly answer their question because the

amount of faith is not as important as its genuineness. *What is faith?*

*It is complete trust and loyalty to God that results in a willingness to
do His **will. ** Faith *is not* something we

use to put on a show for others. It is a complete and humble obedience to
God’s will, readiness to do what-

ever He calls us to do. This amount of faith is not as important as the
right kind of faith—*Faith in our all-powerful God.*

*Pastor Sather*

Faith is not something we use to put on a show for others. It is a complete and humble obedience to God’s will, readiness to do what ever He calls us to do. This amount of faith is not as important as the right kind of faith-Faith in our all-powerful God.

prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with hearts longing for a faith that is genuine and unwavering. Teach us to trust in Your power and sovereignty, not in the amount of our faith, but in the depth of our devotion to You. May our obedience and willingness to do Your will be a testament to the faith You have graciously given us. We surrender ourselves to Your divine plan, knowing that with even a small measure of true faith, we can move mountains. In Your mighty name, we pray. Amen.

message_id: 174e128926cda37c
subject   : Subject: FAITH THAT CAUSES HEALING (10-1-20)
from      : Pastor Sather <pastor.sather5@gmail.com>
to        : undisclosed-recipients:;
date      : Wed, 30 Sep 2020 17:36:07 -0500
===================================================================

*Today’s Verse:*

*Peter says to the crowd, “the name of Jesus has healed this man—**and you
know how lame he was before. Faith in Jesus’ name has **caused the healing
before your very eyes.” *(Acts. 3:16)



*Today’s Reflection:*

Jesus not the apostles, received the glory for the healing

of the lame man. In those days a man’s name represented his charcater. it
stood for his authority and power. By using Jesus’ name, Peter showed who
gave him the auth-ority and power to heal, the apostles did not emphasize
what they could do but what God could do through them. Jesus’ name is not
to be used as magic—it must be used

in faith. When we pray in Jesus name, we must remember that it is Christ
himself *not merely the sound of His name, that gives our prayers **their
power.*

* Pastor Sather*

Help us to remember that when we pray in Jesus' name, it is not merely the sound of His name, but the faith in His character and power that gives our prayers their strength. May we always seek to glorify You, not ourselves, in all that we do. Amen.
